section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document clarifies interaction among Dynamic Updates in the Domain Name System (DNS UPDATE) , Classless IN-ADDR.ARPA delegation , and Secure Domain Name System (DNS) Dynamic Update .

RFC 2317 describes how to use CNAME records in IN-ADDR.ARPA DNS zones to split administrative control over IN-ADDR.ARPA data. The described method is perfectly compatible with standard DNS resolution but DNS update requests need special handling.
Before introduction of RFC 2317, clients were able to generate node name
The problem is that RFC 2136 section DNS node names in DNS Update messages to succesfully update intended nodes.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: TODO: Canonicalization allows the active attacker to redirect the update to a node of his choice. Update authentication using TSIG or other means should allow clients to modify only minimal set nodes to prevent attacker from modifying other nodes.
